title.native: デジモンクロスウォーズ

description:
Taiki Kudou, an upbeat seventh-grade boy who always helps people in need, encounters a Digimon named Shoutmon, who brings him and his friends to the Digital World. With his friends Akari Hinomoto and Zenjirou Tsurugi, they form Team Xros Heart to compete against rival teams battling for supremacy, with their ultimate goal of taking down the evil Bagura Empire, who plans to conquer the Digital World.

(Source: Anime News Network)

tags.name: Isekai
tags.description: Features characters being transported into an alternate world setting and having to adapt to their new surroundings.

tags.name: Virtual World
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the world inside a video game.

tags.name: Henshin
tags.description: Prominently features character or costume transformations which often grant special abilities.

tags.name: Primarily Child Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters below a high school age.

tags.name: Monster Girl
tags.description: Prominently features a female character who is part-monster.

tags.name: Artificial Intelligence
tags.description: Intelligent non-organic machines that work and react similarly to humans.

tags.name: Anthropomorphism
tags.description: Contains non-human character(s) that have attributes or characteristics of a human being.

tags.name: Proxy Battle
tags.description: A proxy battle is a battle where humans use creatures/robots to do the fighting for them, either by commanding those creatures/robots or by simply evolving them/changing them into battle mode.

node.description:
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/吉田玲子) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reiko_Yoshida)

Yoshida has written and supervised numerous scripts for anime series, live-action dramas and films. Her major works include [Kaleido Star](https://anilist.co/anime/427), [Aria](https://anilist.co/anime/477), [Maria-sama ga Miteru](https://anilist.co/anime/158), [D.Gray-man](https://anilist.co/anime/1482), [K-On!](https://anilist.co/anime/5680), [Bakuman](https://anilist.co/anime/7674) and [Girls und Panzer](https://anilist.co/anime/14131). In more recent works, she has supervised the screenplays for [Majestic Prince](https://anilist.co/anime/15863), [Non Non Biyori](https://anilist.co/anime/17549), [A Town Where You Live](https://anilist.co/anime/17741), [Tamako Market](https://anilist.co/anime/16417), [Yowamushi Pedal](https://anilist.co/anime/18179) and [Castle Town Dandelion](https://anilist.co/anime/20951). In films, she wrote the screenplay for Ghibli's [The Cat Returns](https://anilist.co/anime/597), the original films that would make up [Digimon: The Movie](https://anilist.co/anime/2961), Kyoto Animation’s hit anime film [A Silent Voice](https://anilist.co/anime/20954), and the film adaptations of Osamu Tezuka's [Buddha](https://anilist.co/anime/7014), the last one's [second film](https://anilist.co/anime/20500) was given a stamp of approval by the Dalai Lama.

Among her works, she was recognized for Best Screenplay/Original Work for [Girls und Panzer](https://anilist.co/anime/14131) at the Tokyo Anime Award Festival in 2014, and she won another Best Screenplay/Original Work award in 2017. In 2018, she wrote the screenplay for [Violet Evergarden](https://anilist.co/anime/21827) which aired on TV in Japan and is licensed by Netflix.

Yoshida also wrote the story for the manga series [Tokyo Mew Mew](https://anilist.co/manga/30554).

(Source: Wikipedia)
He has worked as both a story writer for manga and anime. He graduated from Meiji University.

He's credited on all relevant media as the creator of the original concept and character designs for the virtual pet franchise, Digimon. However, nothing is known about Hongo as an individual.

The name is actually a pseudonym for the three most important figures in the creation of the Digimon franchise: Aki Maita, one of the two creators of the original Tamagotchi; Hiroshi Izawa, the author of the first Digimon manga; and Takeichi Hongo, the director of marketing for Bandai.

(Source: Digimon Wikia)

[Website](http://wadakoji.com/) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/和田光司)

Kouji Wada was best known for performing several songs for the [Digimon](https://anilist.co/anime/552/) series.

On April 3, 2016, he suddenly passed away due to complications related to nasopharynx cancer.

[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/marciagomesdubladora) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=100009968520339)

Márcia Gomes was a Brazilian actress, voice actress, and dubbing director.

__Non-Anime Roles:__
~!- Felix The Cat (Felix The Cat [1st dub] and Felix the Cat: The Movie)
- Janine Melnitz (Ghostbusters franchise)
- Mai Tsubasa / Change Phoenix (Blitzkrieg Squadron Changeman)
- Andy Panda (1st voice; Andy Panda)
- Titi [1st voice; 1986-1987], Jeremias [1st voice; 1986-1988] and Dona Cebola [2nd voice; 1988]  (Turma da Mônica)
- Hansel (1st dub; Hansel and Gretel 1987)
- Mariana Villareal (Los Ricos También Lloran)
- Ethel Peabody (Gotham)
!~

[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/fringon/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Fringon) | [Facebook](https://facebook.com/pedro.alcantara.1610) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/@fringontv) | [TikTok](https://www.tiktok.com/@_fringon) | [Twitch](https://www.twitch.tv/fringon)

Pedro Alcântara Machado de Vasconcelos (Jacareí, November 22, 1994) is a Brazilian actor, voice actor, singer and dubbing director. He is the son of voice actor [Ricardo Vasconcelos](https://anilist.co/staff/202508/).

__Non-Anime Roles:__
~!- Pablo (1st voice - 1st-3rd season; The Backyardigans)
- Beck Oliver (Victorious)
- Tyler Navarro / Dino Charge Red Ranger (Power Rangers: Dino Charge)
- Coby (One Piece Live Action)
- Kim Dong-Ha (Happy Ending)
- Reminald R. "Remy" Remington (Big City Greens)
- Bradley Nicholson (Milo Murphy's Law)
- Charles Ronson (Horizon Zero Dawn)
- Hae-Rang (Sweet Home)
- Howard "Howie" (High School Musical: The Musical: The Series)
- Silas Plaskett (The Walking Dead: World Beyond)
- Charles "Charlie" St. George (13 Reasons Why)
- Ron Stoppable (Kim Possible Live Action)
!~
Fernanda Bock is a Brazilian voice actress.

João Ângelo was a Brazilian actor, voice actor and dubbing director.

In dubbing, he started in 1961, at Ibrasom, having as his teacher, the director and voice actor, José Soares.

He joined the AIC around 1962, led by Emerson Camargo. On the occasion, he participates in series and drawings, such as The Witch (3rd, 4th and 6th Seasons), Lancer (1st Season), Daniel Boone, Voyage to the Bottom of the Sea (3rd Season), Lost in Space (3rd Season), Jeannie is A Genius (Season 2, 3, and 4), and Woodpecker.

His most active period in the studio is from 1962-1976. In the 1970s, he also joined Álamo, Odil Fono Brasil and BKS.

In 1975, along with other colleagues, João created a cooperative called Com-Arte, which provided services to dubbing studios. The cooperative's main role was to work for Estúdio Silvio Santos.

The first TVS dubbing unit, known as NDD-TVS, implemented by one of the station's directors, Salathiel Lage, was in a space in Anhanguera, where Baú a Felicidade and Lojas Tamacavy operated, all owned by Silvio Santos. Later, this space would host the SBT. Later, the nucleus was transferred to Vila Guilherme, where the TVS studios used to be. The cooperative existed until 1980, when TVS created two fixed studios on the site, Elenco and Maga.

He remained active until mid-2019, when he retired. He died on July 13, 2021.
